- Change the function so that it adds/removes user with the uid only if:

   - called from an firebase admin-sdk environment
   - (future feat): user with request.auth.uid is an admin of the event/organization

- Modify handleLeave cloud function to handle adding people from waitlist to the new open spot

body: - Closing laptop/opening after a certain duration causes firestore listener to drop (due to app check?) make it resume without refreshing the page.
title: Implement auto connecting after connection drop
Add a "click to read description" feature in event page

body:
(Goal: A user who has signed up can remove themselves from the event.)
   1. On the event page, add a "Leave Event" button.
   2. Display this button only if the user's uid is currently in the signups sub-collection.
   3. When the button is clicked, delete the user's document from the events/{eventId}/signups sub-collection.
title: Leave an event

body:
(Goal: A logged-in user can sign up for an event with open spots.)
   1. On the event page, add a "Sign Up" button.
   2. Display this button only if:
       * The user is logged in.
       * The number of current signups is less than the event's capacity.
       * The user is not already on the signup list.
   3. When the button is clicked, write a new document to the events/{eventId}/signups sub-collection. The
      document ID should be the user's uid.
title: Sign Up for an Event

body:
(Goal: The event page shows a live list of everyone who has signed up.)

   1. Create a roster component.
   2.  On the event page, create a real-time listener for the events/{eventId}/signups sub-collection in Firestore.
   3. Whenever the list of signups changes, update the component's state.
   4. Display the list of attendee names  in order of signups.
title: Real-time Attendee Roster

body:
(Goal: A user can visit a direct link to an event and see its details.)
   1. Manually create an event in Firestore.
   2. Create the dynamic page file: src/app/events/[eventId]/page.tsx.
   3. On this page, get the eventId from the URL parameters.
   4. create an eventView component
   5. create subcomponents as needed
   6. Implement the logic to fetch the corresponding event document from your Firestore events collection.
   7. Display the basic event information in the appropriate components
title: Event Page and Data Fetching

body:
Users can log in with their Google account.

   1. Install the Firebase SDK (npm install firebase).
   2. Create a central Firebase utility file (e.g., src/lib/firebase.ts) that initializes the app and exports the
      auth and firestore services.
   3. Create a simple "Login" button component that triggers the Google Sign-In with Firebase.
   4. Implement the logic to only allow users with @u.northwestern.edu and @northwestern.edu emails to sign in
      successfully.
   5. After a successful login, save the user's info (uid, displayName, email) to the users collection in
      Firestore.
   6. Display the user's name and a "Logout" button when they are signed in.
title: User Authentication
